body_html:
@vishwakftw Ah, I see! So they are just not documented yet, I will add them to the docs. This way I think functional.selu and functional.rrelu can be safely deprecated then.

input = torch.randn(2)
torch.selu(input)

tensor([1.4261, 0.2250])

input = torch.randn(2)
torch.rrelu(input)

tensor([-0.0398, -0.1174])
body_text:
@vishwakftw Ah, I see! So they are just not documented yet, I will add them to the docs. This way I think functional.selu and functional.rrelu can be safely deprecated then.
input = torch.randn(2)
torch.selu(input)

input = torch.randn(2)

tensor([-0.0398, -0.1174])
body:
@vishwakftw Ah, I see! So they are just not documented yet, I will add them to the docs. This way I think `functional.selu` and `functional.rrelu` can be safely deprecated then.

```
input = torch.randn(2)
torch.selu(input)
```
tensor([1.4261, 0.2250])

```
input = torch.randn(2)
torch.rrelu(input)
```
tensor([-0.0398, -0.1174])
